definition: to be available at any time/to be on call
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
variant of 叫[jiao4]
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Doctor Liu is on call at all times.
sentences.chinese: 不论什么时候刘医生随叫随到。

sentences.english: My job entails being on call 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作需要一天24小时随叫随到。

sentences.english: Do I need to be available twenty four hours a day?
sentences.chinese: 我真的需要每天24小时随叫随到吗？

sentences.english: The price actual benefit, the service arriving, is within call.
sentences.chinese: 价格实惠，服务到位，随叫随到。

sentences.english: I am always just a phone call away.
sentences.chinese: 只要您一个电话，我随叫随到。

sentences.english: For six weeks out of the year, I'm on 24/7 on-call duty.
sentences.chinese: 一年有六个星期，我必须全天候随叫随到。

sentences.english: Guarantee arrival at site called in case refrigeratory is failure.
sentences.chinese: 冷库出现故障，保证作到随叫随到。

definition: to come when called (idiom); ready and compliant/always at sb's beck and call
to grant whatever is asked for/to accede to every plea
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
to follow everywhere/to always be there for sb at their beck and call
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
in every possible way (idiom); meticulous
to start and finish work
responsible and diligent (idiom)
to work hard without complaint (idiom)
regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
picking up and dropping off/greeting and sending off/shuttle (transport service)
to work office hours/on duty
to finish work/to get off work
to run errands
to check the guard posts/(coll.) to check up on sb (spouse, employee etc)
special (or reserved) train (or bus etc)/limousine/private car used as a taxi and booked via a smartphone app
